author: Emma
text:
Really frustrating experience.

First, I could not purchase an item because the website would not connect to the two factor authentication page for my visa credit card. After a week of contacting them and getting nowhere, I gave up and purchased using my mobile (which I don't like to do for reasons of security).

I then purchased a bag for just over £1K plus £25 in shipping and verification. For 7 days nothing happened, the seller ghosted me and then on day 7 I was informed the item was 'no longer available'. Beware, basically a seller can pull out up to 7 days after you have bought an item and just cancel without any apology or consequence. 

Finally, to add insult to injury, I received an email stating I would receive a refund for the list price but excluding the shipping and administration costs. Allegedly I will receive a second email (at a later date) for the refund of shipping and admin costs, but frankly I do not trust this.

Horrible experience all round. Did not receive the item and have yet to receive a refund. Customer service was far worse than Ebay, which is very disappointing given their positioning as a luxury reseller platform. Avoid!
title: Really frustrating experience.

author: MarKo
text: Although I have used Vestiaire a lot of times as a buyer, as a seller the service is not up to standards. I am also an expert seller that has sold many of my luxury personally bought, used and collected items so I am no stranger to the luxury fashion market.  I recently sold a pair of vintage Gucci sneakers bought from the boutique and the “authentication” team deemed that they could not verify the authenticity and automatically cancelled my sale. I had to raise a dispute and request a second check but had I not I would just lose my money and my item. The verification team should know better and this makes me wonder whether what I bought previously as authentic could be also falsely checked.
title: Authentication team not experts

author: S.Lovely
text:
Purchased a pair of Dior trainers -

My first order was cancelled for no reason and no explanation. VC gave me multiple excuses, and the shoe I bargained down was given to someone else. Despite me purchasing first and VC confirming an issue on their end, the shoes were gone!

Antagonised me by sending me tracking updates regarding the order they cancelled. I should've gone back to Ebay at this very moment. 

Purchase number 2:
Dior trainers, the sole cannot be cleaned on this particular style, and it's tough to get marks off as its a delicate fabric

They authenticated the first pair I ordered. I have pairs already of this shoe; I wanted to ensure it was a legit site.
The shoe came filthy! Poor condition, although stated as good. The shoe size wasn't for me; they had been worn so much clearly by a wide foot. So I have to resell. 
The second shoe was perfect. just as described in good condition, much like the pairs I have ( these come in various colours) 

The most recent pair (3) is horrible! The shoe has the fabric colouring on the sole, bleach marks and meaning this cannot be removed. The seller advertised them as gently worn and had no clear pictures of the soles.
Upon receiving the shoe - I made a claim/report instantly.

I contacted them the next day due to no acknowledgement of the first report. 

When speaking with an advisor called Reyanne B - she said my report wasn't received and I have to make another one, which I did with her on the chat,
She confirmed receipt and said that I'd get an email regarding this inconvenience as soon as.

Still nothing. 
I contact again as the window is closing to make a report. The lady named Cathyrine M says I should make yet another report because they didn't receive it; I'm exhausted with the horrible customer service that this company proved.
I made it clear I wouldn't be making any more reports as I have made enough- If this isn't rectified and they note that this shoe style cannot be cleaned, they need to mark all as fair and price accordingly.

I will contact my bank as a last resort if this isn't sorted out; I'm tired and worn thin with them.
I've never been so stressed talking to people who don't care about the customers! 

You can't expect people to be out of pocket with items that aren't wearable. If I wanted to thrift for vintage worn through things, I would go to places that provide this. Theirs meant to be a level of quality provided.
title: Purchased a pair of Dior trainers -

author: Alison Power
text:
Have had a few genuine offers and able to sell well, despite the huge commission. 
Also they refuse to list many items from great UK designer brands and even brands like Michael Michael Kors where you only just get an option to list as an "unknown brand" or they otherwise they won't take it all. This is 
Including premium brands which they fail to recognise.
But worst thing is so so many fake offers - which means you can't accept other perhaps genuine offers until nearly two days are up for the fake offer to be invalidated!!! By that stage the othe purchasers have lost interest.
Sometimes multiple fake offers are made  from the same site but the only recourse is their fairly useless WhatsApp customer service area which takes ages and says it'll take action but nothing seems to happen. The spurious buyers just keep on bidding and takes some time to realise they're fantasists...
Also if you spot a small mistake on their international sizing system - ie you list something in one country's size and it appears wrong on another market's size - you can't seem to revise this but have to go through the interminable customer service chat - if they actually answer -  where many of the operators just don't seem to understand what you're trying to explain. Can take half an afternoon so not worth the trouble.
I speak French so have been able to reply to some potential purchasers queries in French person.
However the main problem is that  some of these so called buyers are more like time wasters and never banned.
After reply from Vestiare...

Btw have just had a very nice reply from Vestiare - below - but illustrates how  customer service doesn't keep tabs on what the app uploading system is saying.
They claim they list brands like Michael Michael Kors but I've literally just grabbed another screenshot of their site saying they no longer take orders from Michael Michael Kors! I still find this strange given MK's popularity.
Would upload screenshot but there's no facility here on Trustpilot for doing so! 
But generally his is what I mean about frustrations dealing with this site - although a few great sales achieved - and getting different replies when looking at potential listed brands accepted, messaging customer service etc and getting different answers for queries if at all!
title: So many fake offers and bad customer service …

author: SM
text: So far I’d be giving 0 if I could. This company has sent me a fake designer bag despite having ‘authentication’ checks. I even paid customs and am out of hundreds of pounds! The support team don’t read the messages properly and reply with something totally irrelevant and they are making it impossible for me to return the item, and haven’t even guaranteed a refund! I don’t have a printer for their return form, I went to a parcelshop they confirmed was correct but the return is invalid, therefore they don’t care to help further and it’s now been 5 days since anyone last wrote by email. Avoid this business, they have stolen nearly £300 off me and don’t seem to care at all! It’s a scam and there are no ‘experts’ because the differences between the bag I got from them and the real Thing is worlds apart in differences. I wouldn’t have known either if I didn’t buy the same bag in another colourway directly from Telfar myself. The logo, the size of the bag, the shape is all different but same name! I requested a manager to contact me also, still nothing a week later, I wrote about this in January!! Shocking!!!
title: So far I’d be giving 0 if I could

author: Seth Evans
text:
I placed multiple orders, of those orders all of them had issues: 

1) Not as described - seller said that the shoes were brand new unworn, when they arrived they had clearly been worn and had gold pen written on the sole. VC suggested that these should be reposted to their site with the original description and photos. Which in my opinion is disgusting. Then another person will have my issue! I centrally after threatening trading standards I was offered the option to send them back, but only if I was able to print a returns label they provided (which thus far I have been unable to do, they gave me 3 days to sort this! WHO HAS A PRINTER AT HOME IN 2022 and also, we’re in a global pandemic. Utterly disgraceful. 
2) Item never arrived - I purchased a top that just never arrived. VC asked me to write a handwritten statement and a copy of my passport just to be able to investigate?! I spoke to a lawyer who told me explicitly not to send my passport via email and they shouldn’t be asking for this information. But I was told without a copy of my passport they couldn’t help, evenetslly I had no other option than to send a redacted version of the passport, I’m waiting for them to tell me this isn’t acceptable and to require my passport details. The whole thing seems very fraudulent. 

I have reported them to the relevant authorities and to my card issuer in the hope they can get this sorted, if not I will be out of pocket hinders of pounds. 

I am beyond disgusted with this company and if I could give less than 1 star I would. If I can save just one person the stress and anxiety of shopping at Vestiaire Collective by writing this review then it will be enough. 

I cannot stress enough. 

AVOID AVOID AVOID.
title: AVOID AVOID AVOID

text:

author: M Bartle
text:
I ordered boots on 17 January and the seller shipped them a week later. However, the shipping status never got updated and after the timeframe for delivery had elapsed I launched an enquiry with Vestiaire Collective. On 29 January I sent them my passport and a declaration I had not received the item and they confirmed they had launched an enquiry with UPS. I have not heard anything despite follow ups and now most recently I asked to cancel my order. It has clearly been lost and I don't want to wait months while UPS may or may not find it. It has been a month and I haven't received my item, so I want a refund. I was REFUSED a refund. Vestiaire claim they won't give me one because I made a shipping enquiry. So now I can't cancel? I've asked to receive a phone call from a manger because to date everything has been by email or chat and nobody has phoned me yet. This is appalling. NOBODY USE THIS COMPANY. I'm surprised people have not launched complaints under the Consumer Protection Act. I will be considering this myself.

UPDATE on 19 February. Someone allegedly from the head office has emailed me with the exact same response, they are refusing to refund me even though my order was placed 5 weeks ago. This is atrocious.  I am now considering reporting this company to as many consumer protection agencies as possible. 

My order reference is 20290953
title: Refusing refund, never received item

author: Isssys Polyu
text: I recently made a sale for my Hermes Kelly handbag (Ref : 20782374) and shipped my bag to the HK hub. They then file a quality control report stating that my bag is in poor condition with some photos taken on cracked corners and leather. However, I have taken some photos before shipping the item and they show perfect corners. I suspect that my bag was damaged by the staff during quality check. I contacted the help centre many times but no one is getting back to me through email. The damaged bag is now shipping back to me… I do not wish to receive a bag that was seriously damaged by VC staff… If VC does not give me a detailed explanation or refund me the amount I should get from this sale (HKD $60449.93) to my Paypal account, I will have no choice but to file a dispute on Paypal or take legal actions.
title: Staff damaged my Hermes bag
